<rep_header_filename>Web server filename reply</rep_header_filename>
<rep_header_filename_explain>Matches (regex) the filename in the Web server response header.[br]
Typically when downloading a file, a web server will reply with the header:[br]
[b]Content-Disposition: Attachment; filename=TheFilename.exe[b][br]
Set here the pattern that will matches the filename.[br]
Examples:[br]
[b]\.vbe[/b][br] 
[b]\.vbs[/b][br]
will matches all *.vbe, *.vbs files.[br]or[br]
[b]\.vb[a-z][/b][br] 
will matches all *.vb(a or b or c or e or s) files.
</rep_header_filename_explain>
<rep_mime_type>Mime type (reply)</rep_mime_type>
<rep_mime_type_explain>
pattern matching on the request content-type header[br]
Example:[br]
video/x-mpeg2a[br]
video/x-ms-asf[br]
video/x-ms-asf-plugin[br]
video/x-ms-wm[br]
video/x-ms-wmx[br]
video/x-pn-realvideo[br]
video/quicktime[br]
video/x-msvideo[br]
video/mpeg[br]
video/mp4v-es[br]
pattern matching against the mime type of the reply received by the proxy.[br]
Can be used to detect file download or some types HTTP tunneling requests.
</rep_mime_type_explain>

<RHSBL>Right Hand Side BLs</RHSBL>
<RHSBL_EXPLAIN>An RHSBL lists the domain names used in the from or reply-to e-mail address.[br]
RHSBLs are of debatable effectiveness since many spams either use forged from addresses or use from addresses containing popular freemail domain names, 
such as @gmail.com, @yahoo.com, or @hotmail.com</RHSBL_EXPLAIN>
<right>Right</right>
<rock_explain_form>La caché de roca tiene un gran potencial porque permite compartir una sola caché entre varios trabajadores. Es la %C3%BAltima pieza que hace que la compartici%C3%B3n entre trabajadores sea completa[br].
Todos los objetos de la caché se almacenan en un %C3%BAnico archivo disperso como una especie de base de datos[br].
Dado que la caché de roca se implementa como un proceso separado, se convierte en un cuello de botella de rendimiento a menos que se utilice la propia caché de memoria compartida de Proxy para almacenar todos los objetos.[br]
La configuraci%C3%B3n por defecto de proxy s%C3%B3lo almacena objetos peque%C3%B1os en la memoria caché, por lo que es necesario cambiar ese l%C3%ADmite y hacer que la memoria caché sea de gran tama%C3%B1o[br].
Por otro lado, cuando no se utiliza la caché de roca, es mejor maximizar el uso de los b%C3%BAferes del sistema de archivos del n%C3%BAcleo en lugar de la caché de memoria del proxy para los objetos grandes</rock_explain_form>
<rock_store>Rock store</rock_store>

<routing>Routing</routing>
<routing_lmtp_table_explain>This table list routing rules per final mailbox account to the final MDA (Mail Delivery Agent) it designed to define where to put messages in the final way.[br]
Basically it designed to use LMTP protocol to communicate to a Cyrus-Imap or a Zarafa destination server.[br]
</routing_lmtp_table_explain>

With this table you can forward messages to a specific recipient email address.[br]
All added rules are stronger than organizations routing rules..</routing_recipient_table_explain>

<RSA_PRIVATE_KEY>RSA Private key</RSA_PRIVATE_KEY>
<RsyncMaxcnx>The maximum number of simultaneous connections this service will allow.[br]
Any clients connecting when the maximum has been reached will receive a message telling them to try later.[br]
The default is 0, which means no limit</RsyncMaxcnx>
<RsyncReverseLookup>Controls whether the daemon performs a reverse lookup on the client's IP address to determine its hostname</RsyncReverseLookup>
<rsync_host_allow_explain>In diesem Abschnitt k%C3%B6nnen Sie eine Liste von durch Kommas und/oder Leerzeichen getrennten Mustern angeben
angeben, die mit dem Hostnamen und der IP-Adresse eines verbindenden Clients abgeglichen werden.[br]
Wenn keines der Muster %C3%BCbereinstimmt, wird die Verbindung abgewiesen.[br]
Jedes Muster kann in einer von f%C3%BCnf Formen vorliegen:[br]
[ul]
[li]Eine punktierte dezimale IPv4-Adresse der Form [b]a.b.c.d[/b], oder eine IPv6-Adresse der Form [b]a:b:c::d:e:f[/b].[br]
In diesem Fall muss die IP-Adresse des ankommenden Rechners genau %C3%BCbereinstimmen.[/li]
[li]Eine [b]Adresse/Maske[/b] in der Form ipaddr/n, wobei ipaddr die IP-Adresse und n die Anzahl der einzelnen [b]Bits[/b] in
der Netzmaske ist.[br]
Alle IP-Adressen, die mit der maskierten IP-Adresse %C3%BCbereinstimmen, werden zugelassen.[/li]
[li]Eine Adresse/Maske in der Form [b]ipaddr/maskaddr[/b], wobei ipaddr die IP-Adresse und maskaddr die Netzmaske in Dezimalpunktschreibweise f%C3%BCr IPv4 ist,
oder %C3%A4hnlich f%C3%BCr IPv6, z. B. ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:: anstelle von /64.[br]
Alle IP-Adressen, die mit der maskierten IP-Adresse %C3%BCbereinstimmen, werden zugelassen.[/li]
[li]Ein [b]Hostname[/b]-Muster mit Wildcards.[br]
Wenn der Hostname der verbindenden IP-Adresse (wie durch einen Reverse-Lookup ermittelt) mit dem Wildcard-Namen
%C3%BCbereinstimmt (unter Verwendung der gleichen Regeln wie beim normalen Abgleich von Unix-Dateinamen), wird der Client zugelassen [br].
Dies funktioniert nur, wenn &quot;Reverse Lookup&quot; aktiviert ist (die Voreinstellung).[/li]
[li]Ein Hostname.[br]
Ein [b]einfacher Hostname[/b] wird mit dem Reverse-DNS der verbindenden IP abgeglichen (wenn &quot;Reverse-Lookup&quot; aktiviert ist),
und/oder die IP des angegebenen Hostnamens wird mit der verbindenden IP abgeglichen (wenn &quot;Forward Lookup&quot; aktiviert ist,
was standardm%C3%A4%C3%9Fig der Fall ist).[br]
Jede %C3%9Cbereinstimmung wird zugelassen.[/li]
[/ul]</rsync_host_allow_explain>
<rsync_out_port_explain>You need to allow the 873 TCP outgoing port in order to let downloading packages.</rsync_out_port_explain>

<samba_security_mode_explain>There are only two types of security modes for Samba, share-level and user-level, 
which are collectively known as security levels.[br]
Share-level security can only be implemented in one way, while user-level security can be implemented in one of four different ways.[br]
The different ways of implementing a security level are called security modes.
</samba_security_mode_explain>

<servernames_explain>Servernamen bestimmen, welcher Serverblock f%C3%BCr eine bestimmte Anfrage verwendet wird.
Sie k%C3%B6nnen mit exakten Namen, Platzhalternamen oder regul%C3%A4ren Ausdr%C3%BCcken definiert werden [br].
Beispiele:[br]
[b]beispiel.org[/b][br]
[b]www.example.org[/b][br]
[b]*.example.org[/b][br]
[b]mail.*[/b][br]
[b]192.168.1.1[/b][br]
[b]~^(?&lt;Benutzer&gt;.+).example.net$[/b][br]
Bei der Suche nach einem virtuellen Server anhand des Namens, wenn der Name mit mehr als einer der
der angegebenen Varianten %C3%BCbereinstimmt, z. B. wenn sowohl der Platzhaltername als auch der regul%C3%A4re Ausdruck %C3%BCbereinstimmen,
wird die erste %C3%BCbereinstimmende Variante gew%C3%A4hlt, und zwar in der folgenden Reihenfolge:[br]
exakter Name[br]
l%C3%A4ngster Platzhaltername, der mit einem Sternchen beginnt, z. B. *.example.org[br]
l%C3%A4ngster Platzhaltername, der mit einem Sternchen endet, z. B. mail.*[br]
erster passender regul%C3%A4rer Ausdruck (in der Reihenfolge des Auftretens)[br]</servernames_explain>
<servername_squidguard_explain>
This is the default Web page error address [b]that will be used to reach Artica web page error service.[/b] when not address has been defined in your rules.[br]
You can give here an IP address or an hostname.[br]
In rules, you cannot define an SSL redirect page.[br]So this address will be the main address used for all banned SSL websites.[br]
Do not define here http:// prefix  
Pay attention of the SSL denied web sites.[br]
Using an IP address will generate an SSL certificate error.[bf]
[b]Note:[/b] If you did not want to use the local web page error service, use the dedicated section for that.[br]
</servername_squidguard_explain>

<server_did_not_have_enough_memory_ufdbcat>[b]Warning not enough memory[/b][br]
Server does not meet memory requirements (more than 5.9GB).[br]
Your server is enabled with all proxy features, we estimate these values:[br]
For the [b]Categories service[/b]: 2.5GB[br]
For the [b]Statistics Database service [/b]: 2GB[br]
For the [b]Proxy service[/b]: about 1GB[br]
For the [b]system[b] itself and other tasks:512MB[br]
Click on this warning in order to reduce features and safe memory on your proxy service.
</server_did_not_have_enough_memory_ufdbcat>

<server_persistent_connections_explain>Wenn diese Direktive aktiv ist, wird die Unterst%C3%BCtzung f%C3%BCr persistente Verbindungen zu Servern aktiviert, wenn dies von den Zielservern erlaubt wird.[br]
Diese Direktive steuert, ob der Proxy persistente HTTP-Verbindungen zu Ursprungsservern und Nachbarn verwendet oder nicht.[br]

<server_protection_only>File servers protection only</server_protection_only>
<server_watchdog_load_explain>The watchdog is able to check the system load.[br]
In most case, a loaded server should have impact on the Internet access speed.[br]
This check allows you to define 2 numbers, the [b]if overloaded[b] number just create a warning event with processes report.[br]
The [b]if overloaded (Max)[b] allows you to define action that watchdog can perform if the server load reach the value.[br]
Actions are:[br]
[b]None[b]: Do nothing
[b]fail-over[b]: switch to backup server (if fail-over is set)
[b]Restart[b]: Restart the proxy service.
[b]Reboot[b]: Reboot the server
[br]
</server_watchdog_load_explain>
<server_watchdog_memory_explain>If turn to green, the watchdog is able to check the current memory usage.[br]
If memory usage exceed defined values then you can allow Artica to restart some services in order to release memory.
</server_watchdog_memory_explain>

<service_firewall_explain>
[b]Required entries[/b][br][br]
The following are required for all simple services:[br]
service name: [b]myservice[/b][br]
Ports: [b]proto[/b]/sports[/b][br] 
Local ports: [b]cports[/b][br]
[br]
[b]myservice[/b] is the name we will give our service.[br]
[b]proto[/b] is anything that firewall accepts as a protocol e.g. "tcp", "udp", "icmp" and numeric protocol values.[br]
[b]sports[/b] is the ports the server is listening at. It is a space-separated list of port numbers, names and ranges (from:to).The keyword any will match any server port.[br]
[b]cports[/b] is the ports the client may use to initiate a connection. It is a space-separated list of port numbers, names and ranges (from:to). The keyword any will match any client port. The keyword default will match default client ports.
</service_firewall_explain>

<shared_memory_locking_disable>Desactivar el bloqueo de la memoria compartida</shared_memory_locking_disable>
<shared_memory_locking_disable_explain>Si se asegura que toda la memoria compartida requerida est%C3¡ disponible &quot;bloqueando&quot; esa
La alternativa es un tiempo de arranque m%C3¡s r%C3¡pido seguido de un rendimiento ligeramente m%C3¡s lento y, si no hay suficiente memoria RAM disponible durante el tiempo de ejecuci%C3%B3n, misteriosas ca%C3%ADdas.
La funci%C3%B3n de [b]m%C3%BAltiples procesadores[/b] utiliza muchos segmentos de memoria compartida.[br]
Estos segmentos son llevados al espacio de memoria del proxy usando una llamada al sistema mmap[br].
Durante el inicio del proxy, la llamada mmap() a menudo tiene éxito independientemente de si el sistema tiene suficiente RAM.[br]
En general, el servicio proxy no puede saber si el kernel aplica esta pol%C3%ADtica de asignaci%C3%B3n de memoria &quot;optimista&quot; (pero los kernels modernos m%C3¡s populares suelen utilizarla).</shared_memory_locking_disable_explain>

<share_level_security_explain>With share-level security, the server accepts only a password without an explicit username from the client.[br]
The server expects a password for each share, independent of the username.[br]
There have been recent reports that Microsoft Windows clients have compatibility issues with share-level security servers.</share_level_security_explain>

<shorewall_masq>dynamic NAT (Masquerading)</shorewall_masq>
<shorewall_masq_explain>
Outgoing traffic from a specific interface to other interface can be translated (so that Forewall and other routers know where to send responses to).
[br]For example:[br]
10.0.0.0/8 as source network and eth0 as destination interface 
means that all traffic originating from 10.0.0.0/8 and want to outgoing will pass through the eth0 network interface using the IP address assigned to eth0.[br]
[br]If you wish to make all traffic appear from a particular IP address, it can be specified in Translated address.[br]
[br][b]Note:[/b] To define all network, set 0.0.0.0/0 as Network source.         
</shorewall_masq_explain>

<smtpp_howto>Sie k%C3%B6nnen jeden MUA (Mail User Agent) verwenden, der SMTP-Authentifizierung unterst%C3%BCtzt.
Stellen Sie den Client so ein, dass er diesen Server als SMTP-Server verwendet.[br]
[b]Die Adresse des echten SMTP-Servers muss als Teil des SMTP-Benutzernamens konfiguriert werden.[/b][br]
Das Format f%C3%BCr den Benutzernamen ist username@server, wobei server die Adresse des SMTP-Servers und username
die Anmeldung des Benutzers auf diesem SMTP-Server ist[br].
Das Login selbst kann das Zeichen %C3%82'@%C3%82' enthalten.[br][b]Es wird nur Klartext-Authentifizierung unterst%C3%BCtzt,
weil die Challenge-Response-Authentifizierung (CRAM-MD5, SPA, usw.) eine Challenge vom Server erfordert, bevor
der Dienst wei%C3%9F, mit welchem Server er sich verbinden soll.</smtpp_howto>

<SOA_COMPUTER_EXPLAIN>The FQDN of the name server that was the original or primary source of data for this zone.</SOA_COMPUTER_EXPLAIN>
<SOA_EMAIL_EXPLAIN>Email address of the administrator responsible for this zone.[br]
(As usual, the email address is encoded as a name.[br]
The part of the email address before the @ becomes the first label of the name;[br]
the domain name after the @ becomes the rest of the name.[br]
In zone-file format, dots in labels are escaped with backslashes; thus the email address john.doe@example.com would be represented in a zone file as john\.doe.example.com.)
</SOA_EMAIL_EXPLAIN>
<SOA_EXPIRE_EXPLAIN>The time internal (in seconds) that specifies the upper limit on the time internal that can elapse before the zone is no longer authoritative. This is when the secondary name servers will expire if they are unable to refresh. Recommended value â€“ up to 2419200 (672 Hours)</SOA_EXPIRE_EXPLAIN>
<SOA_NAME_EXPLAIN>This is the name that this record will have in the DNS Made Easy system, you will use this name to identify your record</SOA_NAME_EXPLAIN>
<SOA_NEG_EXPLAIN>The amount of time a record not found is cached.[br]Recommended values can vary, between 180 and 172800 (3 min â€“ 2 days)</SOA_NEG_EXPLAIN>
<SOA_RECORD_EXPLAIN>Ein Start-of-Authority-Datensatz (abgek%C3%BCrzt SOA-Datensatz) ist eine Art Ressourcendatensatz im Domain Name System (DNS), der administrative Informationen %C3%BCber die Zone enth%C3%A4lt, insbesondere in Bezug auf Zonentransfers.</SOA_RECORD_EXPLAIN>
<SOA_REFRESH_EXPLAIN>The time interval (in seconds) before the zone should be refreshed. Recommended value â€“ 86400 (24 Hours)</SOA_REFRESH_EXPLAIN>
<SOA_RETRY_EXPLAIN>The time interval (in seconds) before a failed refresh should be retried. Recommended value â€“ 7200 (2 Hours)</SOA_RETRY_EXPLAIN>

SOCKS allows to use almost any application protocol without limitation.[br]
This implementation also allows to open priviledged port on server (if socks has sufficient privileges).
</sockdpr_explain>

<softdelete_lifetime>Softdelete LifeTime</softdelete_lifetime>
<softdelete_lifetime_explain>
Soft Deletes always remain in the database, until they are purged.[br]
When a item will be purged is dependent of a configuration value.[br]
This option defines how long a deleted item will remain in the database:[br]
Softdelete LifeTime: 30 Days[br]
In this example, the value is set to 30.[br]This means that deleted items will be purged from the
database 30 days after they were deleted.[br]When this option is set to 0, the items will never be
removed from the database</softdelete_lifetime_explain>

<software_version>Software version</software_version>
<soft_delete_explain>
If a user deletes emails, calendar items or complete folders, there are by default moved to the Deleted Items folder.[br]
When the items are removed from the Deleted Items, the items still will not be fully removed from the database.[br]Rather, they are marked as deleted, so the user does not see the items. Even when a user deletes items with <SHIFT> <delete> they are not removed from the database, but marked as deleted.
This makes restoring of items quick and easy from Outlook: choose Extra from the menu bar in Outlook menu, and click on Restore deleted items. Items are grouped by the folder they were deleted from. Most items will appear in the Deleted Items folder as they have been removed from that location.
Soft deletes always remain in the database, until they are purged.
</soft_delete_explain>
<Soft_Read_Error_Rate>Soft read error rate</Soft_Read_Error_Rate>

<sourcelist_explain>
You can set here source IP addresses:[br]
A single IPv4 address: 10.4.2.240[br]
A CDIR notation: 10.0.0.0/16[br]
A Range of IPv4 addresses: 10.4.2.0 - 10.5.9.25
</sourcelist_explain>
<sources>Quellen</sources>
<sources_files>Sources files</sources_files>
<sourcetype>Source type</sourcetype>
<source_based_routing>Source based routing</source_based_routing>
<source_based_routing_explain>If green, routes will be based on the interface source.[br]
source routing allows a sender of a packet to partially or completely specify the route 
the packet takes through the network.[br]
In contrast, in non-source routing protocols, routers in the network determine the path 
based on the packet's destination.[br]
Source routing allows easier troubleshooting, improved traceroute, 
and enables a node to discover all the possible routes to a host.[br]
It does not allow a source to directly manage network performance by forcing packets to travel over one path to prevent congestion on another.
</source_based_routing_explain>

<spamassassin_escrap_explain>Set here patterns (separated by a carriage return ) of [b]Sender[/b] that could be matched in messages.[br]
[br]You can use the star "*" or some regular expressions:[br]
[0-9]+: for 012345678[br]
[A-Za-z]+: For AbCdEfGh[br]
(com|fr|de|br): for com or fr or de or br.[br]
example:[br]
[b]mydomain[0-9]+.(com|fr|de|br)[/b][br]
</spamassassin_escrap_explain>
<spamassassin_not_enabled>The Anti-Spam feature is not enabled in the policy service.</spamassassin_not_enabled>
<spamassassin_rows_explain>Detect any pattern in the body message including base64 content.[br]You can use regular expressions:[br]
/CUST.-Document-[A-Z]+-[0-9]+-[0-9A-Z]+/[br]
/INVOICE-[0-9\-]+/[br]
\s+(sex|bitch|suck|fuck)\s+[br]
a phrase to detect
</spamassassin_rows_explain>
<SPAMASSASSIN_RULES>SpamAssassin rules</SPAMASSASSIN_RULES>
<SPAMASSASSIN_RULES_TEXT>Build advanced anti-spam content rules accordind message parts.</SPAMASSASSIN_RULES_TEXT>
<spamassassin_subjects_explain>
Set here patterns (separated by a carriage return ) of [b]Subject[/b] that could be matched in messages.[br]
[br]You can use the star "*" or some regular expressions:[br]
[0-9]+: for 012345678[br]
[A-Za-z]+: For AbCdEfGh[br]
(com|fr|de|br): for com or fr or de or br.[br]
#END: End of line.
^: Start of line.
example:[br]
[b]mydomain[0-9]+.(com|fr|de|br)[/b][br]
</spamassassin_subjects_explain>
<spamassassin_uris_explain>Set here patterns (separated by a carriage return ) of Urls could be matched in messages.[br]
[br]You can use the star "*" or some regular expressions:[br]
[0-9]+: for 012345678[br]
[A-Za-z]+: For AbCdEfGh[br]
(com|fr|de|br): for com or fr or de or br.[br]
example:[br]
[b]mydomain[0-9]+.(com|fr|de|br)/link.php?[A-Z]=[0-9]+[/b][br]
</spamassassin_uris_explain>
<spamass_scr1>When the Bayesian classifier and network tests are not in use</spamass_scr1>
<spamass_scr2>When the Bayesian classifier is not in use, but network tests are</spamass_scr2>
<spamass_scr3>When the Bayesian classifier is in use, but network tests are not</spamass_scr3>
<spamass_scr4>When the Bayesian classifier and network tests are both in use</spamass_scr4>
<spamass_wbl_explain>Supports two wildcards. A '*' implies 0, 1, or many letters and '?' implies 0 or 1 letters.[br]
[b]user@domain.net[/b]: Filters this one address.[br]
[b]*@domain.net[/b]: Filters all addresses from domain.net.[br]
[b]*domain.net[/b]: Filters addresses from mydomain.net, thisdomain.net, and domain.net[br]
[b]sos*@domain.net[/b]: Filters sos@domain.net, sos1@domain.net, sos12@domain.net, and sos1234567@domain.net.[br]
[b]sos12?@domain.net[/b]: Filters sos121@domain.net and sos128@domain.net, but NOT sos12@domain.net or sos1234@domain.net[br]
[b]sos123@*domain.net[/b]: Filters sos123@mydomain.net and sos123@domain.net[br]
[b]sos123@??domain.net[/b]: Filters sos123@mydomain.net, sos123@adomain.net, and sos123@domain.net, but NOT sos123@thisdomain.net[br]
</spamass_wbl_explain>

<spam_subrule_explain>The [b]Pattern[/b] textarea is a regular expression ( .*?@domain\.tld or [0-9]+-[A-z]+@domain\.tld ).[br]
You can group several expressions using the pipe and parentheses:[br]
(sex|porn|love|night|[0-9]+orn)[br]
the {header} field must be filled only if you choose [b]Data in message header[/b] and the rule type.[br]
[b]Special pseudo-headers[/b]
[b]ToCc[/b] can be used to mean the contents of both the To and Cc headers.[br]
[b]EnvelopeFrom[/b] is the address used in the MAIL FROM: phase of the SMTP transaction that delivered this message.[br]
[b]ALL:raw[/b] will return a pristine (unmodified) header section.[br]
</spam_subrule_explain>

<SPF_DNS_HOWTO>
Set up SPF to prevent spammers from sending unauthorized emails from your domain.[br]
This type of spamming is called spoofing.[br]
[b]Sender Policy Framework (SPF)[/b] is an email security method to prevent spoofing from your domain by just adding a record in your public DNS.[br]
Set up the SPF record for your domain by adding a TXT record to your domain host.[br]
Adding the TXT record doesnâ€™t affect your mail flow.[br]
Use the text generated and replace [b]1.2.3.4,1.2.3.5[/b] by your mx1 and mx2 public IP addresses.
</SPF_DNS_HOWTO>
<SplashPages>Splash service</SplashPages>
<SplunkServerAddress>Splunk server address</SplunkServerAddress>
<SPNEGO_explain>Simple and Protected GSSAPI Negotiation Mechanism (SPNEGO), 
often pronounced "spen-go", is a GSSAPI "pseudo mechanism" 
that is used to negotiate one of a number of possible real mechanisms.[br]
SPNEGO is used when a client application wants to authenticate to a remote server,
but neither end is sure what authentication protocols the other supports.[br]
The pseudo-mechanism uses a protocol to determine what common GSSAPI mechanisms are available, 
selects one and then dispatches all further security operations to it.[br]
This can help organizations deploy new security mechanisms in a phased manner.
</SPNEGO_explain>

<SquidBlackListDoNotCheckMD5>Do not verify databases integrity</SquidBlackListDoNotCheckMD5>

<squidcach32_applyexplain>This operation will perform caches operations on disks.

<SquidCacheLevel0>[br]No cache[/b][br]
All caches are disabled, this level deny the proxy to not cache any object.
[br]Cache objects in memory will be disabled.
In this mode, Proxy just act as a  web filtering router
</SquidCacheLevel0>
<SquidCacheLevel1>[br]Minimal cache[/b][br]
This is the default Proxy cache used in most cases.[br]
Your specific caches rules are disabled.[br]
Proxy query remote websites for freshed pages in standard mode and try to store object for 3 days maximal.
Artica dynamic enforce rule are disabled.
</SquidCacheLevel1>
<SquidCacheLevel2>[br]Smooth cache[/b][br]
Your specific caches rules are enabled.[br]
Proxy query remote websites for freshed pages in standard mode and try to store object for 3 days maximal.
Artica dynamic enforce rule are disabled.
</SquidCacheLevel2>
<SquidCacheLevel3>[br]Medium cache[/b][br]
Images, css, javascript, multimedia files are stored for a long period.[br]
Your specific caches rules are enabled.[br]
Proxy query remote websites for freshed pages in standard mode and try to store object for 3 days maximal.
Artica dynamic enforce rule is disabled by default.
</SquidCacheLevel3>
<SquidCacheLevel4>[br]Strong cache[/b][br]
Proxy will ignore browsers refresh operation.[br]
Images, css, javascript, multimedia files are stored for a long period.[br]
Your specific caches rules are enabled.[br]
Proxy query remote websites for freshed pages slowly and try to store object for 4 days maximal.
Artica dynamic enforce rule is enabled by default.
</SquidCacheLevel4>
<SquidCacheReloadTTL_explain>Ban Artica to rebuild/restart proxy service in x minutes interval</SquidCacheReloadTTL_explain>
<SquidClientDSTPassThru>DNS mismatch checking</SquidClientDSTPassThru>
<SquidClientDSTPassThru_explain>With NAT or TPROXY intercepted traffic Proxy may pass the request
directly to the original client destination IP or seek a faster source using the HTTP Host header.[br]
Using Host to locate alternative servers can provide faster connectivity with a range of failure recovery options.[br]
But can also lead to connectivity trouble when the client and server are attempting stateful interactions unaware 
of the proxy.[br]
This option (if checked) prevents alternative DNS entries being	located to send intercepted 
traffic DIRECT to an origin server.[br]
The clients original destination IP and port will be used instead.[br]
Regardless of this option setting, when dealing with intercepted traffic Proxy will verify the Host: header 
and any traffic which fails Host verification will be treated as if this option is enabled.
</SquidClientDSTPassThru_explain>
<SquidClientParams_text>In diesem Abschnitt k%C3%B6nnen Sie die Anzahl der Plugins einstellen, die vom Proxy-Dienst geladen werden.
Bei den Plugins sollte es sich um die Anzahl der Authentifizierungsprozesse, Webfilterprozesse usw. handeln.
Je mehr Prozesse Sie hinzuf%C3%BCgen, desto mehr Anfragen kann Ihr Proxy bearbeiten, aber dies erh%C3%B6ht die Systemlast.[br]
Wenn Sie den Modus mit mehreren Prozessoren verwenden, m%C3%BCssen Sie die Anzahl der Prozesse mit der CPU-Anzahl multiplizieren.</SquidClientParams_text>
<SquidCpuNumber>Anzahl der zu verwendenden CPU(s)</SquidCpuNumber>
<SquidCpuNumber_explain>Standardm%C3%A4%C3%9Fig verwendet der Proxy die CPU 0. Dieses Feld erm%C3%B6glicht es Ihnen, mehrere Proxy-Instanzen zu erstellen[br].
Jede Instanz verwendet ihre eigene CPU, um Anfragen zu verarbeiten[br].
Der Haupt-Proxy-Dienst ist f%C3%BCr den Lastausgleich zwischen den einzelnen CPUs zust%C3%A4ndig.</SquidCpuNumber_explain>

<SquidGuardWebFollowExtensions_explain>It is recommended not to redirect to a simple HTML page because 
not all blocked web objects are HTML-based objects.[br] This feature produces an empty image for blocked images 
and produces a valid javascript document for blocked javascript objects.[br]
If a blocked image is redirected to an HTML page, the browser receives HTML code where it expects an image and gets confused, 
may generate errors, or become slow.
</SquidGuardWebFollowExtensions_explain>

If this server is connected to an Active Directory server, Artica will try to find the email address of the connected user.[br]
In other case a popup will be displayed in order to let the user fill it's email address.
</squidguard_smtp_complain>

<SquidPerformance_0>[b]Voller Funktionsumfang[/b][br]Diese Option erfordert mindestens mehr als [b]5,9GB Speicher[/b].[br]
Es wird verwendet: [br]
[br][b]Kategorien Dienst[/b]: Dieser Dienst erm%C3%B6glicht es Ihnen, ACLs zu definieren, um Benutzer in Echtzeit zu beschr%C3%A4nken mit
[br][b]Kategorien-Dienst[/b]: Dieser Dienst erm%C3%B6glicht es Ihnen, ACLs zu definieren, um Benutzer in Echtzeit mit Bandbreite, Quoten und Kategorien einzuschr%C3%A4nken.[br][b]Kategorien-Datenbank speichert mehr als 30 Millionen klassifizierte Websites wie Pornos, Filme, Audio-Video, soziale Netzwerke...[br]Dieser Dienst ben%C3%B6tigt etwa 2,5 GB Speicherplatz[br]
[br][b]Statistik-Dienst[/b]: Mit diesem Dienst k%C3%B6nnen Sie Diagramme/Grafiken der besuchten Websites und Ihrer Benutzer abrufen.[br]Dieser Dienst ben%C3%B6tigte etwa 1,5 GB Speicherplatz.
[br][b]Echtzeit-Monitor[/b]: Dieser Dienst erm%C3%B6glicht die Anzeige der Proxy-Bandbreite und des Datenflusses.[br]Dieser Dienst ben%C3%B6tigte ca. 128MB Speicherplatz.</SquidPerformance_0>
<SquidPerformance_1>
[b]Medium features[/b][br]
This option require at least [b]3GB of memory[/b][br]
It will disable : [br]
[br][b]Categories service[/b]: You will not be able to set ACLs according categories.[br]Statistics cannot display charts and graphs according categories.[br]
It will use : [br]
[br][b]Statistics service[/b]: This service allows you to get charts/graphs of the visited web sites and of your users.[br]
[br][b]Realtime monitor[/b]: This service allows you to display Proxy bandwith and flow use.[br]
</SquidPerformance_1>
<SquidPerformance_2>
[b]Less features, best performances[/b][br]
This option require at least [b]1.5GB of memory[/b][br]
It will disable : [br]
[br][b]Categories service[/b]: You will not be able to set ACLs according categories.[br]Statistics cannot display charts and graphs according categories.[br]
[br][b]Statistics service[/b]: Only Analytic Generator is available to display statistics[br]
[br][b]Realtime monitor[/b]: Only pure proxy events can be displayed without extra features.[br]
</SquidPerformance_2>

<squidqota_uidAD>This rule can be used if your proxy is linked to a Microsoft Active Directory server.[br]
Click on the Browse Button in order to choose the Active Directory group.[br]
Each user stored by the selected group will be matched to this rule.[br]
[b]Note: the rule defined matches each member, not the entire Active Directory Group.[/b][br]For example,
If you define 5Mb for the Group "Allowed_Internet", each member will get a quota of 5Mb.
</squidqota_uidAD>

<squid_dynamic_cache_rules_explain>This feature allow artica to dynamically enforce Proxy cache rules by analyzing statistics.[br]
Artica will scan each 4 hours statistics and enforce the TOP downloaded websites into system cache with the level 5.[br]
If you using default parameters, the top 100 websites that are "not already cached" will be enforced.[br]
The level 5 defines caching data for a minimal of 3 days and for a maximal of 1 week with a minimal refresh interval.[br]
To not encounter issues on some websites that require to not be freshed, you can use the blacklist in order to ban Artica enforcing the cache system. 
</squid_dynamic_cache_rules_explain>
<squid_enable_append_domain>Wenn diese Option eingeschaltet ist, f%C3%BCgt der Proxy den lokalen Dom%C3%A4nennamen an die Hostnamen ohne Dom%C3%A4ne an.[br]
Wenn Ihre Abfrage http://host1 lautet, f%C3%BCgt der Proxy automatisch die lokale Domain hinzu und %C3%A4ndert die URL in http://host1.local.domain[br]
Wenn Sie den Proxy verwenden, um auf interne Websites zuzugreifen, die ohne Domainnamen verf%C3%BCgbar sind, schalten Sie diese Funktion auf Rot.</squid_enable_append_domain>

[br]Note:[/b] MAC addresses cannot be logged in this mode.[br]
</squid_enable_nat_compatibility_text>

<squid_identd_daemon_explain>Das Ident-Protokoll (Identification Protocol, IDENT), spezifiziert in RFC 1413, ist ein Internet-Protokoll, das hilft, den Benutzer einer bestimmten TCP-Verbindung zu identifizieren.
Der Identification-Daemon erm%C3%B6glicht es Ihnen, Ihre Benutzer anhand des Anmeldenamens zu identifizieren[br].
Dies vereinfacht die Verwaltung, da Sie nicht st%C3%A4ndig IP-Adressen mit Computern abgleichen m%C3%BCssen [br].
Nat%C3%BCrlich k%C3%B6nnen Sie damit auch Benutzer auf der Grundlage ihres Benutzernamens zu Gruppen hinzuf%C3%BCgen.
Die Verwendung dieser Funktion f%C3%BCr die Benutzerauthentifizierung hat mehrere Vorteile gegen%C3%BCber den SSL- oder Proxy-Anmeldemethoden[br].
In erster Linie muss der Benutzer keinen Benutzernamen und kein Kennwort eingeben, um sich %C3%BCber das Internet anzumelden.
Stattdessen wird ein Ident-Dienst, der auf dem Client-System l%C3%A4uft, automatisch den Windows-Benutzernamen an den Proxy %C3%BCbermitteln.
[b]Sie m%C3%BCssen ein Tool (siehe unten) auf jedem Computer installieren.[br]
[Sie m%C3%BCssen den [b]TCP-Port 113[/b] durch alle internen Software-Firewalls hindurch zulassen[br].
Beachten Sie, dass im Gegensatz zu fr%C3%BCheren Windows-Versionen Windows Vista/Windows 7/Windows 8 nicht mehr
Pakete, die an Port 113 gesendet werden, nicht mehr abweisen, wenn kein laufender Ident-Server gefunden wird.
Dies hat zur Folge, dass im Browser keine Website angezeigt wird[br].
Daher muss auf allen Rechnern ein Ident-Server installiert sein, wenn Sie Ident in Ihrem Netzwerk verwenden.</squid_identd_daemon_explain>

Do you want to carry out this operation ?
</squid_import_old_logs_warn>
<squid_ipv4_dns_prio>ipV4 proprity on DNS queries</squid_ipv4_dns_prio>
<squid_ipv4_dns_prio_explain>if turn to green then the proxy will try to connect/query on IPv4 websites first.[br]
In most cases the IPv6 Internet is faster than IPv4 Internet.[br]
Depends of your Ipv6 ISP compatibilities you can turn to red in order to 
enable contact websites websites over IPv6 first.[br]
The proxy will still perform both IPv6 and IPv4 DNS lookups before connecting.
</squid_ipv4_dns_prio_explain>

<squid_logs_retention_explain>By default proxy events files (in the source format) are saved and stored in the MySQL database engine.[br]
After several days, the source logs are extracted from the database and should stored outside the server.[br]
You can define here settings when Artica extract sources.[br]
According your country laws you must keep this logs for a specified time (1 year, 2 years...)
</squid_logs_retention_explain>
<squid_logs_urgency>[b]Dienst l%C3%A4uft im Log-Notfall!!:[/b][br]Dies bedeutet, dass kein Platz mehr auf der Partition Log vorhanden ist.[br]
Die Logging-Funktion wurde von Artica deaktiviert.[br]
Das bedeutet, dass Ihr Proxy-Dienst weiterl%C3%A4uft, ohne ein Ereignis auf die Festplatte zu schreiben.[br]
Sie sollten dieses Problem beheben, indem Sie Elemente in der Log-Partition entfernen.[br]
Wenden Sie sich an unser Support-Team, um diesen Vorgang durchzuf%C3%BChren.[br]
Nachdem Sie Ihre Protokollpartition gereinigt haben, k%C3%B6nnen Sie den unten stehenden Link verwenden, um das Protokollsystem wiederherzustellen.</squid_logs_urgency>

<SQUID_ROCK_STORE_EXPLAIN>
When using multiple CPU, each proxy daemon own it's own cache.[br]
There is no "Shared" cache between all CPUs.[br]
You take the risk of having the same file cached multiple times, in different caches.[br]
The Rock store is designed to centralize caching objects for all daemons.[br]
Rock Store uses a single [large] database-style file to store cached responses and metadata.[br]
This part of the design is similar to COSS.[br]
Rock Store does not maintain or rely on swap.state "log" for recovery.[br]
Instead, the database is scanned in the background to load entries when Proxy service starts.[br]
Rock Store maintains its own index of cached entries and avoids global store_table.[br]
</SQUID_ROCK_STORE_EXPLAIN>

<squid_ssl_certificate_explain>Transparent SSL means MAN-IN-THE-MIDDLE.[br]
The proxy will replace the web server certificate by it's own certificate.[br]
This means that you must install the certificate on each browser in order to prevent Auto-signed certificate warning when connecting to a remote SSL website trough the transparent proxy.[br]
This section allows you to save specific informations on the auto-signed certificate.
</squid_ssl_certificate_explain>

<squid_worker_explain>Standardm%C3%A4%C3%9Fig verwendet der Proxy nur eine CPU.[br]In manchen F%C3%A4llen ist das gut.[br]
Wenn Sie mehr als eine CPU verwenden, kann der Proxy eine Art internes Load-Balancing zwischen den einzelnen CPUs einschalten.[br]
Mit dieser Funktion stehen dem Proxy-Dienst mehr Ressourcen zur Beschleunigung des Internets zur Verf%C3%BCgung.</squid_worker_explain>

SMP feature is available only with corporate license.[br]
Click on the link on order to request a quote trough the Artica Management console.[br]
With a purchased corporate license you will be able to to turn this server from a Community edition to a corporate Edition.[br]
A corporate Edition will allow you to enable this feature.
</squid_worker_license_explain>

<sslproxy_foreign_intermediate_certs>Many origin servers fail to send their full server certificate chain for verification, 
assuming the client already has or can easily locate any missing intermediate certificates.[br]
Proxy service uses the certificates from this section to fill in these missing chains when trying to validate origin server certificate chains.
This section is expected to contain more PEM-encoded intermediate certificates.[br]
These certificates are not treated as trusted root certificates, and any self-signed certificate in this section will be ignored.
</sslproxy_foreign_intermediate_certs>

<ssl_buffer_size_text>The size of the buffer used for sending data.[br]
By default, the buffer size is 16k, which corresponds to minimal overhead 
when sending big responses.[br]To minimize Time To First Byte it may be beneficial 
to use smaller values, for example 4k</ssl_buffer_size_text>

<status_label>Status</status_label>
<stemming>Stemming</stemming>
<stemming_explain>Stemming is a process which transforms inflected words into their most basic form.[br]
For example, flooring, floors, floored would probably all be transformed to floor by a stemmer for the 
English language.[br]
In many search engines, the stemming process occurs during indexing.[br]
The index will only contain the stemmed form of words, with exceptions for terms which are 
detected as being probably proper nouns (ie: capitalized).[br]
At query time, the terms entered by the user are stemmed, then matched against the index.[br]
This process results into a smaller index, but it has the grave inconvenient of irrevocably 
losing information during indexing.</stemming_explain>

</StopMaxTTL_explain>

Force Proxy to stores responses even if they don't have explicit reshness or a validator (i.e., Last-Modified or an ETag)[br] 
present, or if they're already stale.[br] By default, Proxy will not cache such responses because they usually can't be
reused.[br]Note that such responses will be stale by default
</store-stale>

<swap_alert>SWAP-Alarm</swap_alert>
<swap_is_disabled>SWAP is disabled</swap_is_disabled>
<swap_label>Speicherauslagerung</swap_label>
<swap_label_explain>Der Swap-Speicher in Linux wird verwendet, wenn der physische Speicher (RAM) voll ist.[br]
Wenn das System mehr Speicherressourcen ben%C3%B6tigt und der RAM voll ist, werden inaktive Seiten im Speicher in den Swap Space verschoben.[br]
Der Swap-Speicher kann zwar Maschinen mit wenig RAM helfen, sollte aber nicht als Ersatz f%C3%BCr mehr RAM angesehen werden.[br]
Der Auslagerungsspeicher befindet sich auf Festplatten, die eine langsamere Zugriffszeit haben als der physische Speicher.</swap_label_explain>
<SWAP_MAX>Swap: Reboot and failover</SWAP_MAX>
<SWAP_MAX_EXPLAPIN>If the Swap exceed in percentage the defined value, Artica will turn the Proxy OFF in order to switch to failover system and reboot the server</SWAP_MAX_EXPLAPIN>
<SWAP_MIN>Clean Swap when exceed</SWAP_MIN>
<SWAP_MIN_EXPLAIN>If the Swap exceed in percentage the defined value, Artica will try to clean the SWAP</SWAP_MIN_EXPLAIN>
<SWAP_MONITOR_EXPLAIN>Check the SWAP usage and perform empty SWAP on defined percentage </SWAP_MONITOR_EXPLAIN>
<swap_timeout>SWAP Zeit%C3%BCberschreitung</swap_timeout>
<swap_timeout_explain>Der Proxy beginnt nicht mit dem Schreiben eines Cache-Objekts auf die Platte oder dem Lesen eines Cache-Objekts von der Platte. [br]
wenn er davon ausgeht, dass der Austauschvorgang mehr als die angegebene Anzahl von Millisekunden in Anspruch nehmen wird.[br].
Standardm%C3%A4%C3%9Fig und wenn auf Null gesetzt, deaktiviert diese Option die Anwendung des E/A-Zeitlimits auf dem Datentr%C3%A4ger.[br]
Ignoriert bei Verwendung eines blockierenden I/O-Moduls, da das Blockieren synchroner I/O dem Proxy-Dienst nicht erlaubt, die voraussichtliche Wartezeit f%C3%BCr den Austausch abzusch%C3%A4tzen.</swap_timeout_explain>
<swap_usage>SWAP usage</swap_usage>
<swap_usage_explain>Dieser Parameter steuert das relative Gewicht, das dem Auslagern von Laufzeitspeicher gegeben wird,
Er kann auf Werte zwischen 0% und 100% gesetzt werden.[br]
Bei einem niedrigen Wert vermeidet der Kernel das Auslagern, bei einem h%C3%B6heren Wert versucht er, den Auslagerungsspeicher zu nutzen. Der Standardwert ist 60%,
Bei den meisten Systemen kann ein Wert von 100 % die Gesamtleistung beeintr%C3%A4chtigen, w%C3%A4hrend ein niedrigerer Wert (sogar 0 %) die Antwortlatenz verringern kann.</swap_usage_explain>

<TCP_Autotuning_settings>TCP Autotuning settings</TCP_Autotuning_settings>
<tcp_fin_timeout>TCP fin Zeit%C3%BCberschreitung</tcp_fin_timeout>
<tcp_fin_timeout_explain>
[b]Default value: 60 seconds[/b][br]
During this TIME_WAIT state, reopening the connection to the client costs less than establishing a new connection.[br]
By reducing the value of this entry.TCP/IP can release closed connections faster, making more resources available for new connections.
</tcp_fin_timeout_explain>

<tcp_time_wait_recycle>TCP time wait recycle</tcp_time_wait_recycle>
<tcp_time_wait_recycle_explain>
Activate TCP time wait port recycle (default disabled).[br]
It is considered sage but may cause problems with services not being able to distinguish clients behind NAT.[br]This option is more agressive than the TCP time wait reuse.[br] We suggest to not use this option if your Artice server is communicate directly with Internet or using NAT
</tcp_time_wait_recycle_explain>
<tcp_time_wait_reuse>TCP time wait reuse</tcp_time_wait_reuse>
<tcp_time_wait_reuse_explain>In case of TIME WAIT problems, enable this option allow the TCP time wait port reusage.[br]
It is considered safe but may cause problems while dealing with some Firewalls or Load-balancers.</tcp_time_wait_reuse_explain>

<tproxy_interfaces_explain>If your use more than one Interface, you can define which will be the interface that handle requests and which Interface will be used to access to Internet.
if no interface is defined, then all interfaces will be hooked to catch requests and the Interface used to handle requests will be used to forward them to Internet.
</tproxy_interfaces_explain>
<tproxy_method>Tproxy method ( aka Transparent Proxy )</tproxy_method>
<tproxy_method_explain>The Tproxy method is a Truly Transparent Proxy.[br]
The proxy needs to be in the direct physical path to be effective.[br]
The Transparent method hide the clients source IP/MAC addresses as the Tproxy method is able to transfert clients IP/MAC addresses.[br]
This method should made troubles if your final router is designed to be HTTP transparent too.[br]
If you plan to use MiKrotiK Firewall, you have to use this method.
</tproxy_method_explain>

<traffic_sent>Traffic sent</traffic_sent>
<traffic_shapping>Begrenzung des Datenverkehrs</traffic_shapping>
<traffic_shapping_explain>Traffic Shaping ist eine Technik zur Verwaltung der Bandbreite in Computernetzwerken, bei der einige oder alle Datagramme verz%C3%B6gert werden, um sie mit einem gew%C3%BCnschten Verkehrsprofil in Einklang zu bringen.
Traffic Shaping wird eingesetzt, um die Leistung zu optimieren oder zu garantieren, die Latenzzeit zu verbessern oder die nutzbare Bandbreite f%C3%BCr bestimmte Pakete zu erh%C3%B6hen, indem andere verz%C3%B6gert werden. Es wird oft mit Traffic Policing verwechselt, der unterschiedlichen, aber verwandten Praxis des Paketdropping und der Paketmarkierung.</traffic_shapping_explain>

<transparent>Transparent</transparent>
<transparentin_explain>Define here networks that will be redirected to the service 
when trying to connects to the specified destination ports.[br]
No network is defined means, redirect all addresses.[br]
[b]You cannot have both include and exclude rules on the same statement.[/b][br]
Possible values are:[br]
An ip address: 192.168.1.1[br]
A CDIR notation: 192.168.1.0/24[br]
</transparentin_explain>
<transparentout_explain>
Define here destinations networks that will be redirected to the service 
No network is defined means, redirect all destinations addresses.[br]
[b]You cannot have both include and exclude rules on the same statement.[/b][br]
Possible values are:[br]
An ip address: 192.168.1.1[br]
A CDIR notation: 192.168.1.0/24[br]
</transparentout_explain>
<transparentport_explain>Define here destination ports that will be redirected to the service.[br]
On port per line.</transparentport_explain>
<transparent_http>HTTP transparent</transparent_http>
<transparent_http_proxy>Transparent HTTP proxy</transparent_http_proxy>
<transparent_method>transparent method</transparent_method>
<transparent_mode_issue>Transparent mode issue</transparent_mode_issue>
<transparent_pattern_explain>Set here the source and the destination you want to forward connections to the proxy.[br]
[b]The source or the destination[/b][br]You can define every systems by set "*" or full network such as 10.10.10.0/24 or a range such as 10.10.10.25-10.10.10.254.[br]
You can define a single item: like an IP address such as 10.10.10.25 or a mac Address such as 94:de:80:68:49:9d or an hostname[br][br]
The [b]Destination port[/b] defines the requested port that will be redirected to the transparent proxy
[br]If you did want to forward packets to the local proxy service, define the remote transparent proxy and the port with this method 192.168.1.25:3128.[br]
If you uncheck the "Transparent" checkbox, then the defined rule is a whitelist rule and allows items to pass trough the computer without local proxy.
<remote_proxy>Remote proxy</transparent_pattern_explain>
<transparent_port>Transparent listen port</transparent_port>
<transparent_ports>Transparente Anschl%C3%BCsse</transparent_ports>
<transparent_ports_explain_v4>Transparente Ports erm%C3%B6glichen es dem Proxy, als Hauptgateway zu fungieren und HTTP/HTTPS-Anfragen zu empfangen, ohne dass die Adresse des Proxys in den Browsern konfiguriert werden muss. [br][b]Wichtig[/b]: Transparente Ports k%C3%B6nnen keine Benutzer authentifizieren.</transparent_ports_explain_v4>

<transparent_ssl>Transparent SSL</transparent_ssl>
<transparent_ssl_explain>Wenn diese Option aktiviert ist, werden TCP-Pakete an den Port 443 an den Proxy weitergeleitet.
Nur zu Protokollierungszwecken (SSL-Caching wird nicht unterst%C3%BCtzt)[br]
Standardm%C3%A4%C3%9Fig entschl%C3%BCsselt der Proxy keine SSL-Datenstr%C3%B6me. [br]Wenn Sie SSL-Seiten zwischenspeichern oder eine Antivirenpr%C3%BCfung durchf%C3%BChren m%C3%B6chten, m%C3%BCssen Sie SSL-Regeln verwenden, um den Proxy zu zwingen, das HTTPs-Protokoll zu entschl%C3%BCsseln.[br]
[b]Vorsicht: [/b]Sie m%C3%BCssen das Proxy-Zertifikat in allen Browsern installieren</transparent_ssl_explain>

<ucarp-advskew>Advertisement skew</ucarp-advskew>
<ucarp-vid>ID of the virtual server</ucarp-vid>
<ucarp-vip>TCP/IP address</ucarp-vip>
<UCARP_HOWTO_EXPLAIN>
With this feature you will be able to link a backup server.[br]
The backup server will be in charge to replace it's network IP address in order to be the main service provider 
until this server return back.[br]
Artica is able to determine the server health and force to switch to backup server 
if some components did not satisfy availabilities parameters.
</UCARP_HOWTO_EXPLAIN>
<UCARP_LICENSE_EXPLAIN>The failover feature can be enabled only with the corporate License.[br]
The corporate license include 2 servers license by default for high availability purpose.</UCARP_LICENSE_EXPLAIN>
<UCARP_MASTER>FailOver (Master mode)</UCARP_MASTER>
<ucarp_master_explain>If enabled, this server will be the primary production server.[br]
Other servers will have this option disabled.
</ucarp_master_explain>
<UCARP_SLAVE>FailOver (Slave mode)</UCARP_SLAVE>
<ucarp_vip_explain>This is the TCP/IP interface that will be used in order to access to server services.[br]
Backups server have to switch to this network address is the master is down.[br]
It must be the same address for the Master and all backups servers.[br]
For example, if you using Artica as the proxy, browsers must point to this IP address.
</ucarp_vip_explain>

<udppm_explain>Forwards datagrams from local to remote UDP port</udppm_explain>
<udp_incoming_outgoing_address>These options are used by the [b]ICP[/b], [b]HTCP[/b], and [b]DNS[/b] modules (if enabled).[br]
Altering it will affect all of them in the same manner.[br]
The incoming interface is used for UDP packets received from other caches.[br]
The outgoing interface is used for UDP packets sent out to other caches.[br]
[b]Incoming interface and Outgoing interface can not have the same value since they both use the same port.[/b]
</udp_incoming_outgoing_address>

<ufdbguard_redirect_ssl_explain>[b]Hinweis[/b]: Gesperrte HTTPs-Websites:[/b][br]
Im Standardmodus ist der Proxy nicht in der Lage, Verbindungen %C3%BCber SSL-Tunnel umzuleiten.[br]
In diesem Fall, wenn SSL-Websites blockiert werden m%C3%BCssen, zeigen die Browser Fehler an und k%C3%B6nnen die Web-Fehlerseite nicht anzeigen.[br]
[b]Wenn Sie m%C3%B6chten, dass Webseitenfehler korrekt angezeigt werden, m%C3%BCssen Sie die SSL-Entschl%C3%BCsselung im Proxy aktivieren.[/b]</ufdbguard_redirect_ssl_explain>

Dadurch werden zus%C3%A4tzliche Funktionen wie das Entsperrsystem, die SMTP-Benachrichtigung oder die %C3%84nderung des Designs der gesperrten Seite nach Regel/Kategorie bereitgestellt.[br]
Wenn Sie diese zus%C3%A4tzlichen Funktionen nicht nutzen m%C3%B6chten, k%C3%B6nnen Sie diese Option auf gr%C3%BCn schalten.[br]
In diesem Fall werden alle gesperrten Websites auf die in diesem Abschnitt angegebenen Ziel-Webseiten umgeleitet.</UfdbUseGlobalWebPage_explain>

<ufdb_reload_byschedule_explain>When updating Databases or compiling webfiltering database, the Web filtering service need to be reloaded.[br]
When service is reloaded, during 15 seconds, the Wbe filtering is unavailable.[br]
To prevent multiple reloads you can turn to green this feature. In this case the service will be reloaded only bu schedule.[br]
If turn to red then your allow Artica to reload the service when needed.
</ufdb_reload_byschedule_explain>

<uri2>URL</uri2>
<URIDNSBL_explain>Dazu werden Nachrichtentext und HTML auf URLs analysiert und daraus Hostnamen extrahiert,
dann werden verschiedene DNS-Blocklisten abgefragt, um entweder: IP-Adressen dieser Hosts (uridnsbl,a) oder deren Nameserver (uridnsbl,ns), oder Dom%C3%A4nennamen dieser Hosts (urirhsbl),
oder die Dom%C3%A4nennamen ihrer Nameserver (urinsrhsbl, urifullnsrhsbl).</URIDNSBL_explain>
<url-lookup-result-during-database-reload-explain>After reloading the Web filtering service,the service should be unavailable during 15/30 seconds.[br]
If turned to green the members will be redirected to the Web page error until the service become ready to accept connections.[br]
It turned to red, members will be allowed to surf trough Internet without any web filter.
</url-lookup-result-during-database-reload-explain>
<url-lookup-result-when-fatal-error-explain>Wenn diese Funktion aktiviert ist und der Web-Filterdienst Probleme hat (Konfigurationsfehler, besch%C3%A4digte Datenbanken oder %C3%BCberlastetes System)
aber noch verf%C3%BCgbar ist, werden alle Anfragen abgelehnt und auf die Fehlerseite umgeleitet.
Ist die Farbe rot, k%C3%B6nnen die Mitglieder ohne Web-Filterung im Internet surfen.</url-lookup-result-when-fatal-error-explain>
<URLhaus_explain>URLhaus is a project operated by abuse.ch.[br]
The purpose of the project is to collect, track and share malware URLs, helping network administrators and security analysts to protect their network and customers from cyber threats.[br]
This option should consume CPU, be sure using a Core i7 or higuer.
</URLhaus_explain>

<url_rewrite_bypass>Bypass the Web filter service on fatal errors</url_rewrite_bypass>
<url_rewrite_bypass_explain>When this is enabled, a request will not go through the
Webfilter service if all processes are busy.  If this is disabled and the webfilter service queue grows too large, proxy will exit
with a FATAL error and ask you to increase the number of processes.[br]
You should only enable this if the webfiltering process is not critical to your caching system.</url_rewrite_bypass_explain>

<UserAuthMagic>User Auth magic</UserAuthMagic>
<UserAuthMagic_explain>
Defines the order of user authentication name and password should be encoded in FTP USER and PASS[br]
commands, as supported by some ftp-client's (i.e. @auth by NcFTP).[br]
Valid settings are: [br]
@auth  for  ftpuser@authuser[@host:port][br]
auth@  for  authuser@[ftpuser@host:port]</UserAuthMagic_explain>

<user_level_security>User-Level security</user_level_security>
<user_level_security_explain>
User-level security is the default setting for Samba.[br]
If the server accepts the client's username/password, the client can then mount multiple shares without specifying a password for each instance.[br]
Samba can also accept session-based username/password requests.[br]
The client maintains multiple authentication contexts by using a unique UID for each logon.
</user_level_security_explain>

<use_tproxy_mode>Use Tproxy mode</use_tproxy_mode>
<use_tproxy_mode_text>The TProxy method TProxy is a feature enhances standard Interception Caching so that 
it further hides the presence of your cache.[br]
Normally with Interception Caching the remote server sees your cache engine as the source of the HTTP request.[br]
TProxy takes this a step further by hiding your cache engine so that the end client is seen as the source 
of the request (even though really they aren't).</use_tproxy_mode_text>
<use_tproxy_mode_text_disabled>Your system kernel did not supports TProxy feature!</use_tproxy_mode_text_disabled>
<use_web_proxy_in_transparent>Use the Web proxy as transparent mode</use_web_proxy_in_transparent>
<use_web_proxy_in_transparent_explain>If checked then Web internet requests from VPN network will be forwarded to the local proxy service using transparent method.[br]
The VPN account will be logged inside the Web proxy events.</use_web_proxy_in_transparent_explain>

<vde_switch_explain>
A Virtual Switch have the same behavior as a physical switch.[br]It can include several virtual interfaces that use the same "real interface" behavior.[br]
Each Virtual Switch is plugged to a real interface in order to communicate with the real network.
</vde_switch_explain>

<vm.lower_zone_protection>Wenn auch der 32-Bit-Hugemem-Kernel nicht in Frage kommt, k%C3%B6nnen Sie versuchen
auf einen Wert von 250 oder mehr zu setzen.[br]
Dies veranlasst den Kernel dazu, die niedrige Zone aggressiver zu verteidigen, indem er
niedrigen Zone vor der Zuweisung von Speicher zu sch%C3%BCtzen, der m%C3%B6glicherweise in der
Um die beste Einstellung f%C3%BCr Ihre Umgebung zu finden, m%C3%BCssen Sie wahrscheinlich etwas experimentieren.
f%C3%BCr Ihre Umgebung zu finden, ist wahrscheinlich notwendig.</vm.lower_zone_protection>
<vm.min_free_kbytes>
Sets the value of each pageâ€™s zone to min, low, or high, depending on themachine.[br]
Default is 724.[br]
For a small machine use 128 KB; for largemachines, use the maximum 4096 KB.[br]
Example: For a machine with more than 8GByte RAM you can easily spare 128MByte (which would translate into a sysctl value of 131072, as it has to be given in kByte).
</vm.min_free_kbytes>
<vm.nr_hugepages>
Try to allocate or deallocate hugepages dynamically.[br] 
The success of this operation depends on the amount of memory that is present in the system for this operation.[br]
Default is 0.
</vm.nr_hugepages>
<vm.overcommit_memory>
Processes commonly allocate memory by calling the function malloc().[br]
The kernel decides if enough RAM is available and either grants or denies the allocation request.[br]
Linux (and a few other Unix-variants) support the ability to over-commit memory; that is, to permit more memory to be allocated than is available 
in physical RAM plus swap.[br]
This is scary, but sometime necessary since applications commonly allocate memory for "worst case" scenarios but never use it.
</vm.overcommit_memory>
<vm.overcommit_ratio>Prozentualer Anteil des Speichers, der f%C3%BCr Overcommit erlaubt ist.[br]Standardwert ist 50.[br] Er gibt den Prozentsatz des physischen RAM an, der zusammen mit dem gesamten Swap den gesamten Adressraum (zuweisbarer Speicher) bildet.[br] Ja, der Begriff ist irref%C3%BChrend, da kein echtes Overcommit stattfindet.[br] Der Standardwert ist 50, was ziemlich unintuitiv bedeutet, dass nur die H%C3%A4lfte des RAM verwendet wird.[br] Da der Swap der einzige dynamisch ver%C3%A4nderliche Bestandteil ist, h%C3%A4tte es mehr Sinn gemacht, daf%C3%BCr eine Prozentangabe zu definieren.[br] Es gibt zwei M%C3%B6glichkeiten sicherzustellen, dass der zuweisbare Speicher der Gr%C3%B6%C3%9Fe des RAM entspricht:[br]
Swap gleich gro%C3%9F wie RAM machen und vm.overcommit_ratio=0 setzen â%80%93 das funktioniert, solange Swap verwendet wird, aber sobald ein Swapoff erfolgt (manuell oder beim Herunterfahren), gibt es eine b%C3%B6se %C3%9Cberraschung: Es kann kein Speicher mehr zugewiesen werden.[br] Gar keiner! Neue Programme k%C3%B6nnen nicht gestartet werden.[br][br]
Setze vm.overcommit_ratio=100 und deaktiviere den Swap.[br] Das ist eine stabile Konfiguration und die bevorzugte Methode auf Maschinen mit ausreichend RAM.[br] Webserver werden durch Swap sowieso verlangsamt, und mit sorgf%C3%A4ltiger Planung kann man sicherstellen, dass die Speicherlimits nicht erreicht werden (z.â%80%AFB. durch Festlegen von Cache-Gr%C3%B6%C3%9Fen, maximalen Prozesszahlen usw.).[br]</vm.overcommit_ratio>
<vm.swappiness>
Determines how likely the VM subsystem is to swap to disk.[br]
Default is 60 and typically is sufficient. [br]
Valid values are 0 to 100.[br]
</vm.swappiness>
<vm.vfs_cache_pressure>This variable controls the tendency of the kernel to reclaim the memory which is used for caching of VFS caches,
versus pagecache and swap.[br]Increasing this value increases the rate at which VFS caches are reclaimed.[br]
It is difficult to know when this should be changed, other than by experimentation.[br]The slabtop command (part of the package procps) shows top memory objects used 
by the kernel.[br]The vfs caches are the "dentry" and the "*_inode_cache" objects.[br]
If these are consuming a large amount of memory in relation to pagecache, it may be worth trying to increase pressure.[br]
Could also help to reduce swapping. The default value is 100. </vm.vfs_cache_pressure>

</vnstat_service_explain>

<warning_bigdata_v3>Be carrefull on the Next Big data engine 0.9.3!</warning_bigdata_v3>
<warning_bigdata_v3_explain>If you read this message, this mean your Big Database service is on 0.9.1,0.9.2 version.[br]
We have released a new 0.9.3 version that improve Database service engine performance.[br]
This new version have a new compress engine in order to reduce data size and memory usage on the system disk.[br]
To use this new version you must [b]destroy[/b] the current database built in 0.9.2 or 0.9.1 version.[br]
If you upgrade to the 0.9.3 or above version without removing the database, you will be able to extract statistics but Artica will [b]be not able to inject new data[/b].[br]
We will develop a new feature to inject old logs to the BigData database.[br]
So if you need to keep history and continue to add data, do not upgrade to 0.9.3 Dataabse Engine or above.[br]
If you want to have better performances and upgrade with a freshed database, upgrade to the new engine and remove the database in the statistics engine section.
</warning_bigdata_v3_explain>

<WARN_SQUID_STATS_PERFS>Es scheint, dass Ihr Server nicht die empfohlene Leistung hat
Es scheint, dass Ihr Server nicht die n%C3%B6tige Leistung hat, um sowohl die erweiterte Artica-Statistikfunktion als auch die Proxy-Dienste zu verarbeiten[br].
Wir empfehlen mindestens 3 GB Speicher und zwei Prozessoren[br].
Artica verwendet MySQL, um Daten zu speichern und Diagramme und Grafiken anzuzeigen.
Mit der Zeit wird die MySQL-Datenbank wachsen und die Serverleistung beanspruchen.
[br][br][b]Sie haben 3 L%C3%B6sungen, um fortzufahren.[/b][br]
[br]
Die erste ist, [b]zu Testzwecken fortzufahren[/b].[br]
Wenn Sie die von Artica erstellten Diagramme und Grafiken mit wenigen Benutzern testen m%C3%B6chten, k%C3%B6nnen Sie auf die Schaltfl%C3%A4che &quot;Ich verstehe, fahre trotzdem fort&quot; klicken [br].
In diesem Fall verschwindet die Warnung und die Statistik-Engine wird weiterlaufen.
[br]
[b]Die zweite M%C3%B6glichkeit ist, die Artica-Statistik-Engine zu deaktivieren.[/b][br][br]
Durch Klicken auf die Schaltfl%C3%A4che &quot;Artica-Statistik-Engine stoppen&quot; wird die MySQL-Datenbank ges%C3%A4ubert, die Statistik-Engine gestoppt und der Statistikbereich
verschwindet.[br]
Bevor Sie auf die Schaltfl%C3%A4che klicken, besuchen Sie die folgenden Links, um die reduzierte Statistik mit Hilfe der Sarg-Software zu aktivieren und CSV-Protokolldateien zu generieren[br].
[br][br]
[b]Die dritte M%C3%B6glichkeit ist die Verwendung eines Remote-Servers f%C3%BCr die Erstellung von Statistiken.[/b][br]
Die Artica Proxy-Statistik-Appliance wurde entwickelt, um Proxy-Statistiken und Web-Filterungsaufgaben zu entlasten.[br]
Diese Appliance ist f%C3%BCr die Zentralisierung der Statistiken f%C3%BCr mehrere Proxys zust%C3%A4ndig.[br]
Sie wurde entwickelt, um zentralisierte Antivirus- und Web-Filterdienste bereitzustellen.
Besuchen Sie den untenstehenden Link, um mehr Informationen %C3%BCber dieses Produkt zu erhalten.
[br][br]
Wenn Sie weitere Informationen ben%C3%B6tigen, wenden Sie sich bitte an unser Support-Team.[br]
[b]Hinweis:[/b]Deaktivierte Statistik-Engine kann in Zukunft wieder aktiviert werden
[br]</WARN_SQUID_STATS_PERFS>

<wccp_asa_int>Internal IP address of our ASA</wccp_asa_int>
<wccp_error_interface>Sie m%C3%BCssen eine Schnittstelle f%C3%BCr die WCCP-Option angeben.</wccp_error_interface>
<wccp_interface_error>WCCP tunnel interface error</wccp_interface_error>
<WCCP_LAYER3>WCCP Layer 3</WCCP_LAYER3>
<WCCP_LAYER3_EXPLAIN>Der Artica Caching Proxy Server muss sich an der gleichen Schnittstelle wie die Clients befinden,
Das ist die einzige Topologie, die ASA WCCP unterst%C3%BCtzt,
Zum Beispiel kann man den Proxy Server nicht im Management Netzwerk betreiben, um ihn f%C3%BCr die Webumleitung im Produktionsnetzwerk zu verwenden.
Die Konfiguration eines Cisco Routers oder eines Layer 3 Switches ist dem ASA sehr %C3%A4hnlich.
Als erstes m%C3%BCssen Sie zwei ACLs erstellen, mit der ersten ACL teilen Sie dem ASA mit, wer und wo sich
der Artica Caching Proxy Sever ist, Sie k%C3%B6nnen diese ACL &quot;wccp-server&quot; nennen:[br]
Unser ASA ist die IP-Adresse 172.16.1.254, der Artica Proxy Server die IP-Adresse 172.16.1.100, das Client-Netzwerk ist 172.16.1.0/224
[code]access-list wccp-server extended permit ip host 172.16.1.100 any[/code][br]
Mit der anderen ACL geben Sie die Clients und den Verkehr an, der abgefangen werden soll.[br]
Aber nat%C3%BCrlich m%C3%BCssen Sie den Proxyserver aus der Client ACL entfernen:[br]
[code]access-list wccp-traffic line 1 extended deny ip host 172.16.8.100 any[br]
access-list wccp-traffic line 2 extended permit tcp ip 172.16.1.0 255.255.255.0 any eq www[/code][br]
Anschlie%C3%9Fend konfigurieren Sie das WCCP-Protokoll auf dem ASA und wenden es auf die Schnittstelle, in diesem Fall die Produktionsschnittstelle, an[br]
[code]wccp web-cache redirect-list wccp-traffic group-list wccp-server[br]
wccp interface produktion web-cache redirect in[/code][br]
Sie k%C3%B6nnen Ihre Konfiguration jederzeit mit :[code]show wccp[/code][br] kontrollieren und debuggen.
Als n%C3%A4chstes m%C3%BCssen Sie im Formular die IP-Adresse des ASA (in diesem Fall 172.16.1.254) angeben.</WCCP_LAYER3_EXPLAIN>
<wccp_local_gre_interface>Local Interface for tunnel</wccp_local_gre_interface>
<wccp_local_gre_ip>Local IP tunnel address</wccp_local_gre_ip>

<webcopy_explain>WebCopy ist eine Reverse-Proxy-Funktion, mit der die Pflege eines CMS vereinfacht wird[br].
Diese Funktion erm%C3%B6glicht es dem Reverse-Proxy, die gesamte Ziel-Website zu durchsuchen, um eine lokale Kopie in einer statischen Version zu erstellen[br].
Wenn Internetnutzer Ihre Website besuchen, rufen sie also nicht die Seiten Ihres Webservers auf, sondern die des Reverse-Proxy-Dienstes.</webcopy_explain>
<WebCopy_task>WebCopy-Aufgabe</WebCopy_task>
<WebCopy_task_explain>In diesem Fall wird der entfernte Webserver nicht abgefragt, und der Reverse-Proxy ist nur f%C3%BCr die Bereitstellung einer statischen Kopie der Website zust%C3%A4ndig. [br]Dadurch wird sichergestellt, dass Ihre entfernte Website definitiv gesch%C3%BCtzt ist und mit maximaler Leistung geladen wird.</WebCopy_task_explain>

<WELCOME_4_1>Artica ist eine Open-Source-Software mit einer [b]Community Edition[/b] und einer [b]Enterprise Edition[/b], die eine Lizenz erfordert, aber erweiterte Funktionen bietet.
Wenn Sie nur die Community Edition (kostenlos) verwenden m%C3%B6chten, klicken Sie auf die Schaltfl%C3%A4che [b]Nur die Community Edition verwenden[/b][br].
In diesem Fall blendet Artica alle Enterprise-Funktionen aus und l%C3%A4sst Sie nur mit den Community-Funktionen spielen[br].</WELCOME_4_1>
<WELCOME_4_2>Erfolg! Sie sind nun Besitzer eines Artica-Servers in der Community-Edition[br].
Die Community Edition erlaubt es Ihnen, diese Appliance f%C3%BCr eine unbegrenzte Zeit und f%C3%BCr eine unbegrenzte Anzahl von Benutzern zu nutzen.
[b]Alle Unternehmensfunktionen sind ausgeblendet[/b].[br]
Wenn Sie Ihre Appliance in eine Enterprise-Edition umwandeln m%C3%B6chten, f%C3%BChren Sie den Assistenten einfach erneut aus, indem Sie den Link im Abschnitt &quot;Lizenz&quot; verwenden.[br]
Nun m%C3%BCssen Sie ausw%C3%A4hlen, welchen Dienst Sie auf diesem Server installieren m%C3%B6chten.[br]
Klicken Sie auf die Schaltfl%C3%A4che [b]Funktionen[/b], um Dienste zu erstellen.</WELCOME_4_2>
<WELCOME_4_3>The Entreprise edition allows you to use dedicated feature for Enterprise.[br]
In order to get a trial period for 30 days or to receive you Enterprise License, fill this form.[br]
You will receive a [b]confirmation eMail[/b] from our Artica team.[br]
This message will confirm that your server can be activated to an Enterprise Edition server.[br]
When the license is expired, your server will return automatically to a community edition server.
</WELCOME_4_3>
<WELCOME_4_4>You using the Artica in Community Edition.[br]
The Community Edition allows you to use this appliance for an unlimited time and for an unlimited users.[br]
If you need to turn to [b]Enterprise Edition[/b] click on the wizard button.
</WELCOME_4_4>

<welcome_php_failover_explain>Welcome to the Failover wizard.[br]
This wizard will help you to setup a High availability service.[br]
If this server is overloaded or some services are unavailable, 
this feature allows you to dynamically switch all network connections to a second Artica server.[br]
So before proceed to next step, you must be sure to have a second installed Artica server in your Network.
<welcome_php_failover_explain>
<welcome_php_failover_explain_1>[b]Network interface of this server[/b][br]
First you have to choose which network interface you want to use as High availability service.[br]
</welcome_php_failover_explain>
<welcome_php_failover_explain_1>[b]Network interface of this server[/b][br]
First you have to choose which network interface you want to use as High availability service.[br]
</welcome_php_failover_explain_1>
<welcome_php_failover_explain_2>[b]Netzwerkzone[/b][br]
Eine Netzwerkzone ist eine Nummer, die es diesem Server und dem Slave-Server erlaubt, in einem einzigen Tunnel zu kommunizieren, um regelm%C3%A4%C3%9Fig ihren Status zu erhalten.[br]
W%C3%A4hlen Sie eine Netzwerkzone aus der Liste.</welcome_php_failover_explain_2>
<welcome_php_failover_explain_3>[b]Slave server[/b][br]
Now this server must connect to the second Artica server Web Management port in order to define the remote server as [b]Slave[/b][br]
Define here network settings in order to transfert settings to the second server.
</welcome_php_failover_explain_3>
<welcome_php_failover_explain_4>[b]Communicate with the slave[/b]
[br]Parameters are ready to be sended to the Artica slave that will be the backup server if this server is busy or down.[br]
By clicking on next button, this server will send to the slave your parameters and change network settings.
</welcome_php_failover_explain_4>
<welcome_php_failover_explain_net>[b]Background IP address[/b][br]
The %s IP address will be the production IP address that will be shared on the 2 servers and used by your users.[br]
It is mandatory to define a new IP address.[br]
This new IP address allows you to connect to this server instead out of the balancing system.
</welcome_php_failover_explain_net>

<welcome_to_dhcp_wizard_1>Select here the network interface that will be used by your DHCP service</welcome_to_dhcp_wizard_1>
<welcome_to_dhcp_wizard_2>Define the network subnet you want to provide, it should be for example 192.168.1.0 with 255.255.255.0 mask or 10.10.1.0 with 255.255.255.0 mask.</welcome_to_dhcp_wizard_2>
<welcome_to_dhcp_wizard_3>Under the defined subnet, choose here the adresses range that the DHCP service will provide.[br]
For example if your subnet is 192.168.1.0/255.255.255.0, you should use from 192.168.1.50 to 192.168.1.254</welcome_to_dhcp_wizard_3>
<welcome_to_dhcp_wizard_4>Para finalizar el asistente de activaci%C3%B3n, debe proporcionar la puerta de enlace principal utilizada, el dominio local y los servidores DNS que servir%C3¡n al servicio DHCP.</welcome_to_dhcp_wizard_4>

<welcome_to_wanproxy_wizard>Welcome to the WAN Compression wizard</welcome_to_wanproxy_wizard>
<welcome_to_wanproxy_wizard_1>Choose in the drop-down list if this proxy is parent proxy or a client proxy.[br]
A parent proxy is able to fetch data from Internet and compress the TCP protocol.[br]
A client proxy is able to fetch the compressed protocol and uncompress it locally.
</welcome_to_wanproxy_wizard_1>
<welcome_to_wanproxy_wizard_2>Set here the Interface and listen port that will be used by the service that will be able to compress TCP protocol.</welcome_to_wanproxy_wizard_2>
<welcome_to_wanproxy_wizard_3>Set here the Ip address and the listen port of your proxy that act as TCP compressor</welcome_to_wanproxy_wizard_3>
<welcome_to_wanproxy_wizard_31>set here the Artica Proxy parent Web console access, address should point to the Web console default port ( 9000 )</welcome_to_wanproxy_wizard_31>

<whitelist_ntlm>Whitelist NTLM Authentication</whitelist_ntlm>
<whitelist_ntlm_explain>This rule will allow the clients to pass trough the proxy without any authentication requested.[br]
It can be used for clients that are not NTLM aware and cannot use silent Windows authentication method such as java applications or web/clients services non NTLM designed.[br]
Item added here cannot be logged with the username, so only IP address and MAC address can be used for statistics purpose.
</whitelist_ntlm_explain>

</wifidog_disconnect_time>

<wifidog_transparent_ssl_explain>If turn ON then authenticated SSL connections will be redirected to the local proxy service</wifidog_transparent_ssl_explain>
<wifidog_use_ssl_explain>If turned to on then both connections (HTTP/HTTPS) will be redirected to the https portal page.[br]
If turned to off then users trying to connect to an HTTP website will be redirected to the http portal page.[br]
Even is turned to off, if users trying to connect to an HTTPs website browsers will be redirected to the https portal page</wifidog_use_ssl_explain>

<winbind_normalize_names>
This parameter controls whether winbindd will replace whitespace in user and group names with an underscore (_) character.[br]
For example, whether the name "Space Kadet" should be replaced with the string "space_kadet".[br]
Frequently Unix shell scripts will have difficulty with usernames contains whitespace due to the default field separator in the shell
</winbind_normalize_names>

<wizard_certificate_1>Welcome on the certificate generation.[br]
In order to create the certificate, define the common name of this certificate.[br]
This should be a server hostname (server.domain.tld).[br]
After submiting this form, Artica will generate a Certificate Signing Request and a default auto-signed certificate.[br]
You will be able to change default settings in the future.
</wizard_certificate_1>
<wizard_kerberosntlm_explain>You can connect your proxy to your Active Directory using 2 authentication methods.[br]
[b]Use the NTLM standard method (join method)[/b] is compatible NTLMv2 and Windows XP or above.[br] 
[b]Use the Kerberos native method is the modern approach but not compatible with Windows XP and 2003.[br]
Both methods require:[br]
The time must be synchronized between Your Active Directory and this server.[br]
Your Active Directory must be resolved by this server.[br]
Your Active Directory must resolve your proxy server.[br]
Your server computer name cannot be longer than 15 characters due to netbios name limitations.[br]
</wizard_kerberosntlm_explain>
<wizard_kerberos_button_off>No use the NTLM standard method (join method).</wizard_kerberos_button_off>
<wizard_kerberos_button_on>Yes use the Kerberos native method</wizard_kerberos_button_on>
<wizard_kerberos_explain>The native kerberos method can be used using Active Directory 2008 or above and Windows vista clients and above.[br]
If you want to use the native Kerberos method, click on the appropriate button.
</wizard_kerberos_explain>

<wizard_stats_apps_step1>Welcome to the Statistics Appliance connection wizard.[br]
This wizard will help you to connect your server to an Artica Statistics Appliance.[br]
This server will be designed to send real-time requests to a defined remote server.[br]
It can use 2 methods you must choose:[br]
The first one is to use [b]Syslog protocol[/b], this method is the best method for your server performance. Your server send real-time events directly to the statistics appliance.[br]
The statistics appliance will be able to parse sent logs and insert them to the statistics Database.[br]
If the connection is broken between the statistics appliance and your server, requests will be loss.[br]
The second one is to inject pre-processed events to the remote database located on the remote statistics servers.[br]
This method uses some CPU/memory of your server because events are pre-processed by your server.[br]
If a connection is broken between your server and the statistics appliance you will not lose events.
</wizard_stats_apps_step1>
<wizard_transparent_button>Enable transparent mode wizard</wizard_transparent_button>
<wizard_transparent_button1>Welcome to the transparent mode wizard.[br]
This wizard will help you to build a "mixed" proxy that will accept both methods:[br]
The first one was [b]transparent mode[/b]: You need to change the main gateway address of your computers in order to point to this server.[br]
The second one was [b]connected mode[/b]: Computer can still use the proxy address in browsers settings.[br]
To implement these methods, define here listens ports for the transparent mode and the connected mode.[br]
And click on the Next button.
</wizard_transparent_button1>
<wizard_transparent_buttonC>This is the non-transparent port used for settings in browsers</wizard_transparent_buttonC>
<wizard_transparent_buttonD>This the transparent port, used to catch HTTP requests and only available on the server side</wizard_transparent_buttonD>
<wizard_transparent_buttonE>This is the transparent SSL port used to catch HTTPS requests and only available on the server side</wizard_transparent_buttonE>
<wizard_transparent_button_final>Your proxy will use the port %p1 in standard mode and browser can use this port to surf trough Internet.[br]
The transparent mode will catch requests to 80 port and redirect them to the local port %p2.[br]
Transparent SSL is %enabled.[br]
If your are agree, click on the Apply button.
</wizard_transparent_button_final>
<wizard_warn_memory>Der Arbeitsspeicher Ihres Servers: %sM wird nicht wirklich empfohlen, um Artica und seine Komponenten richtig zu nutzen.[br]
Wir empfehlen dringend, den Speicher Ihres Servers auf %F + 2 CPUs f%C3%BCr den Produktionsmodus zu erh%C3%B6hen.[br]
Artica ist nicht nur ein Webinterface, sondern eine Reihe von Diensten, die zus%C3%A4tzliche Funktionen auf diesem Server hinzuf%C3%BCgen, wie z.B. Watchdogs, Selbstreparatursysteme, Statistiken...[br]
Nat%C3%BCrlich k%C3%B6nnen Sie weiterhin mit diesem Server spielen.[br]
[b]Aber seien Sie nicht beleidigt, wenn dieser Server %C3%BCberlastet ist oder die Webseiten der Administration nur langsam geladen werden.[/b]</wizard_warn_memory>

<wpad_destination_rules_proxy_explain>Set here proxy addresses in the IP:PORT form.[br]
If no proxy set, then the rule result will be to not use proxy and use the direct mode.[br]
You can define more than one proxy, just separate them with a carriage return.[br]
Example:
Pass to one proxy:[br]
192.168.1.245:3128[br]
Use 192.168.1.245 OR 192.168.1.160.[br]
192.168.1.245:3128[br]
192.168.1.160:3140[br]
</wpad_destination_rules_proxy_explain>

<yararules>Yara Rules</yararules>
<yararules_explain>
YARA is a popular tool that provides a robust language, which is compatible with Perl-based Regular Expressions, 
and is used to examine the suspected files/directories and match strings as is defined in the YARA rules with the file.[br]
Since YARA is friendly way to create patterns, everyone is able to create Yara rules.[br]
Artica is able to downloaded pre-defined Yara rules in order to increase the ClamAV Daemon detection rate.
</yararules_explain>

<ZarafaAlwaysSendDelegates_text>Normally, a user needs to give explicit rights to other users to 
be able to send under their name.[br]
When setting this value to green, the spooler will not check these permissions, 
and will always send the email with 'On behalf of' headers.[br]
Please note that this feature overrides 'send-as' functionality.

<ZarafaCacheQuotaLifeTime>Lifetime for userquota details</ZarafaCacheQuotaLifeTime>
<ZarafaCacheQuotaLifeTime_explain>This sets the lifetime for quota details inside the cache.[br]
If quota details weren't queried during this period it is removed from the cache making room for more often requested quota details.[br]
Set to 0 to never expire, or -1 to disable this cache</ZarafaCacheQuotaLifeTime_explain>
<ZarafaCacheQuotaSize>Size in bytes of the userquota details</ZarafaCacheQuotaSize>
<ZarafaCacheQuotaSize_explain>This cache contains unique id's of objects.[br]
This cache is used twice, also by the index2 cache, which is the inverse of the index1 cache.</ZarafaCacheQuotaSize_explain>

<zarafa_search_explain>
The zarafa-search service, introduced in ZCP 7.10, offers full text searching capabilities for the Zarafa Server.[br]
The service will continuously index all mails, and optionally their attachments, of a single zarafa-server instance.
[br]Each zarafa-server instance in a multi-server setup needs itâ€™s own zarafa-search service.[br]
When searching for a particular mail, the required time to find the requested emails will be seriously reduced.
[br]When attachment indexing is enabled, it is even possible to index the contents of attached files
 (for common file types that contain text).</zarafa_search_explain>
<zarafa_search_text>Zarafa Search offers full text searching capabilities for the Zarafa Server...</zarafa_search_text>

<zarafa_second_instance>Second Zarafa instance</zarafa_second_instance>
<zarafa_second_instance_explain>If turn to green, Artica will run a new Zarafa-server instance connected to the dedicated database.[br]
This second instance is only for local WebMail task purpose in order to test mailboxes stored on the Dedicated MySQL instance.[br]
After enabled, you will be able to create a dedicated FreeWebs Zarafa WebAccess Webmail connected to this storage.
</zarafa_second_instance_explain>
<zarafa_second_instance_text>Create a second Zarafa instance connected to this MySQL dedicated database engine</zarafa_second_instance_text>
<zarafa_second_params_text>Zarafa second instance is a new Zarafa server instance connected to the Zarafa dedicated database Engine.[br]
This second instance listen only local connections.[br]
It is used to connect a WebMail system in order to verify stores behavior.[br]
It should be used to migrate stores from the MySQL standard service to the dedicated MySQL server for Zarafa.
</zarafa_second_params_text>

</zarafa_settings_webmail>
<zarafa_tune_explain>For performace reasons, it is strongly recommended to set the cache settings of the Zarafa server
appropriate for your setup/server.[br]
Each time a request on an item can be found in the cache (cache hits), this avoids calls to other processes and disks/storage.[br]
Setting sensible cache settings certainly increases the performance.[br]
In a server purely running Zarafa, it is advisable to set caches to use around 80% (in total -- including MySQL) 
of the RAM available in your server and can be considered to be a rule-of-thumb.[br]
The other 20% should be free for system processes, other processes (like your MTA) and the web server.[br]
Whenever you set the values too high this can result in the use of swap on your server.[br]
Swapping should be avoided, but we do want to make use of the RAM available.[br]
Therefore these settings should be a healthy balance between the risk of swapping and efficient caching in memory.
</zarafa_tune_explain>
<ZARAFA_WEB_NOT_USEFUL>FreeWebs is able to provide Zarafa Web interface.[br]It seems that the Web service dedicated to Zarafa is enabled in the Zarafa section.[br]
You will safe memory by disable the dedicated web server for Zarafa.</ZARAFA_WEB_NOT_USEFUL>
<zcache_cell_size_explain>
Size in MB of the cell cache.[br]
This is the main cache used in Zarafa.[br]
It caches all data that comes into view in tables (e.g. the view of your inbox, or any other folder).[br]
In an ideal situation, all cells would be cached, so that the database does not need to be queried 
for data when browsing through folders, but this would require around 1.5K per message item (email, appointment task, etc) 
in the entire server.[br]
If you can afford it, set this value as high as possible, up to 50% of your total RAM capacity.
</zcache_cell_size_explain>

[br]The name is case insensitive.</zspam_header_name>
